content: Because of this topic, I tried to experiment with reporting some old posts to the moderators [spam, shit post and zero value], so that I find answers to what I doubt here.QuoteOld post: We generally do not moderate posts this old for on-topicness, substantiveness, multi-posting, and other "cleanliness" issues.I can actually come to one conclusion that reporting old posts is pointless as moderators will likely tag them as bad or unhandled. The warning above is very clear that moderators do not moderate old posts for any reason. So I'm going back to the old principle of still reporting the newest posts even if they are paltry compared to spam and posts that have absolutely no value for old posts - unless I am find malware or something dangerous.To whoever the moderator handled my report, thank you for that.This is just a warning to any of you who want to contribute to cleaning up forum spam by reporting it to the moderator, but if you want to continue for whatever reason, that's up to you.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on April 17, 2023, 04:26:49 PMThis is just a warningBut why? Nothing happens if a Report is marked as Bad. I used to think I should try to avoid them (for esthetic reasons), until I realized it's actually good to test the limits of what gets deleted once in a while.It's trivially easy to find old worthless posts: just go to the start of the Altcoin boards and click one. But reporting them doesn't help at all, nobody reads there, so it's a waste of everyone's time to go through them.I do report older posts once in a while though, for instance when an old spammer became active again. Or if it's link spam: deleting those post removes one more backlink from the internet.

comments.author: Halab
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on April 17, 2023, 04:26:49 PMThe warning above is very clear that moderators do not moderate old posts for any reason.No, that's not exactly what it is written. If there is a very good reason to report an old message (malware, doxing, etc...), report it and a mod will handle it (normally).
